connector.description: Get notified about file events in a directory using java.nio.file.WatchService.

camel.source.path.path.name: camel.source.path.path
camel.source.path.path.description: Path of directory to consume events from.

camel.source.endpoint.antInclude.name: camel.source.endpoint.antInclude
camel.source.endpoint.antInclude.description: ANT style pattern to match files. The file is matched against path relative to endpoint path. Pattern must be also relative (not starting with slash)

camel.source.endpoint.autoCreate.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCreate
camel.source.endpoint.autoCreate.description: Auto create directory if does not exists.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: The number of concurrent consumers. Increase this value, if your route is slow to prevent buffering in queue.

camel.source.endpoint.events.name: camel.source.endpoint.events
camel.source.endpoint.events.description: Comma separated list of events to watch. One of: [CREATE] [MODIFY] [DELETE]

camel.source.endpoint.fileHasher.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileHasher
camel.source.endpoint.fileHasher.description: Reference to io.methvin.watcher.hashing.FileHasher. This prevents emitting duplicate events on some platforms. For working with large files and if you dont need detect multiple modifications per second per file, use #lastModifiedTimeFileHasher. You can also provide custom implementation in registry.

camel.source.endpoint.pollThreads.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollThreads
camel.source.endpoint.pollThreads.description: The number of threads polling WatchService. Increase this value, if you see OVERFLOW messages in log.

camel.source.endpoint.queueSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.queueSize
camel.source.endpoint.queueSize.description: Maximum size of queue between WatchService and consumer. Unbounded by default.

camel.source.endpoint.recursive.name: camel.source.endpoint.recursive
camel.source.endpoint.recursive.description: Watch recursive in current and child directories (including newly created directories).

camel.source.endpoint.useFileHashing.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFileHashing
camel.source.endpoint.useFileHashing.description: Enables or disables file hashing to detect duplicate events. If you disable this, you can get some events multiple times on some platforms and JDKs. Check java.nio.file.WatchService limitations for your target platform.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.file-watch.bridgeErrorHa.name: camel.component.file-watch.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.file-watch.bridgeErrorHa.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.file-watch.concurrentCon.name: camel.component.file-watch.concurrentConsumers
camel.component.file-watch.concurrentCon.description: The number of concurrent consumers. Increase this value, if your route is slow to prevent buffering in queue.

camel.component.file-watch.fileHasher.name: camel.component.file-watch.fileHasher
camel.component.file-watch.fileHasher.description: Reference to io.methvin.watcher.hashing.FileHasher. This prevents emitting duplicate events on some platforms. For working with large files and if you dont need detect multiple modifications per second per file, use #lastModifiedTimeFileHasher. You can also provide custom implementation in registry.

camel.component.file-watch.pollThreads.name: camel.component.file-watch.pollThreads
camel.component.file-watch.pollThreads.description: The number of threads polling WatchService. Increase this value, if you see OVERFLOW messages in log.

camel.component.file-watch.queueSize.name: camel.component.file-watch.queueSize
camel.component.file-watch.queueSize.description: Maximum size of queue between WatchService and consumer. Unbounded by default.

camel.component.file-watch.useFileHashin.name: camel.component.file-watch.useFileHashing
camel.component.file-watch.useFileHashin.description: Enables or disables file hashing to detect duplicate events. If you disable this, you can get some events multiple times on some platforms and JDKs. Check java.nio.file.WatchService limitations for your target platform.

camel.component.file-watch.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.file-watch.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.file-watch.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
